arts.ttl: Stoke City transfer latest as Mark Robins hopes for more to follow Ali Al-Hamadi
arts.sum: Mark Robins still hopes to do one or two more bits of transfer business to give his Stoke City squad a boost after beating competition to sign Ali Al-Hamadi. Robins, who has also brought in left-back Josh Wilson-Esbrand from Man City, has filled up all his five loan spots for a match day squad now but it is clear he would like to bolster other areas before a deadline passes on February 3.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins makes Stoke City demand after goalless draw with Oxford
arts.sum: There were elements of frustration but certain elements when you can see it's starting to come but it's still a way off because of decision making, because of game understanding from people. On the back of the game on Wednesday and the travel and the time that they've been in, I thought they put a really good shift in and I thought we played ok - to a certain degree.

arts.ttl: Stoke City offered £50m solution to woes after firing blanks again
arts.sum: The Potters have now drawn three of Robins’ four league games in charge and have only one victory in their last 15 Championship matches, leaving them dangerously close to the relegation zone. Struggling Stoke remain without a win in the Sky Bet Championship under manager Mark Robins after a disappointing 0-0 draw at home to Oxford United this afternoon.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Oxford as home drought drags on
arts.sum: Stevens popped up in the box with a well-hit low drive that Cumming could only parry but the keeper got lucky that he avoided any lurking Stoke players and Oxford could clear their lines without too much pressure. In a match of few chances, Andrew Moran had a low shot saved in the first half and Enda Stevens broke forward to force a save in the second.

arts.ttl: Robins wait for first Stoke win goes on after Oxford draw
arts.sum: Struggling Stoke remain without a win in the Sky Bet Championship under manager Mark Robins after a disappointing 0-0 draw at home to Oxford.

arts.ttl: Stoke’s winless Championship run continues with goalless draw against Oxford
arts.sum: The Potters have only one victory in their last 15 league matches.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Oxford with surprise return from injury
arts.sum: Ben Wilmot, Niall Ennis, Josh Wilson-Esbrand and Tatsuki Seko drop out of the team from the mid-week defeat at Portsmouth. Stoke City: Johansson, Tchamadeu, Phillips, Rose, Stevens, Baker, Burger, Moran, Gooch, Koumas, Lowe..

arts.ttl: UPDATES: Stoke City v Oxford United – live
arts.sum: All the build-up, action and reaction as Oxford United visit Stoke City for a 12:30pm kick-off in Sky Bet Championship. The U’s are unbeaten in their first seven league matches under Gary Rowett. Stoke City (20th) v Oxford United (14th) Comment below or tweet @OxfordMailOUFC to get involved.

arts.ttl: Stoke City vs Oxford United live - Team news from bet365 Stadium - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: Stoke are tasked with bouncing back from a mid-week defeat at Portsmouth, having put in encouraging performances in the two previous games under new manager Mark Robins at West Bromwich Albion and Sunderland. This is Oxford's first visit here for 25 years and they are led by former Stoke boss Gary Rowett, who has won five of his first seven league games since taking over.

arts.ttl: Managing Stoke City: Finding silk purse in vital transfer window finale
arts.sum: Robins was asked this week if he was frustrated by having wealthy owners who were not allowed to give him the cash they would like to invest in the team - leaving him and the recruitment team trying to find a silk purse with a cow's ear - and whether supporters might appreciate the challenge. Having money in the Championship isn't the answer in itself, as anyone who was around Stoke City in 2018 will attest, but having it and spending it wisely surely makes life a lot easier than trying to come up with an answer when deep pockets have been sewn up by Financial Fair Play rules.
